intro: Lasiorrhiza meyeniana, commonly known as the red sand ratplant, is a succulent plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its fleshy, water-storing leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in sandy or rocky soils. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is cultivated in gardens in regions with similar climates.
